text.p: Tropical Cyclone Daniella is now moving away from Mauritius into the South Indian Ocean. Heavy rains and damaging winds have subsided in Mauritius. Top winds have decreased to 75 mph in the storm and it is now moving southeastward into open waters in the South Indian Ocean, threatening only shipping. Daniella will continue to weaken.

Tropical cyclone 09s has formed in the south Indian Ocean well to the southwest of Sumatra. This system will only be of interest to shipping as it is well away from any land areas. Top winds now at 35 mph will increase to 60 mph in about 48 hours as the system tracks towards the west-southwest.
THERE ARE NO FURTHER EMERGENCY STATEMENTS AT THIS TIME
